TopicTitle: CKAN (The Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network); v1.28.0 - Dyson

Articles.Content: I am also having crashes when opening my CKAN settings, as described https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/2300 . I'm not entirely sure how to perform the workaround though. If someone could explain how to do that for me I would appreciate it.
thanks for looking in to it so fast! and for all the work you put in to maintaining this project. i can wait for the update to come. out my current version of MeckJeb is working fine

I am also having crashes when opening my CKAN settings, as described https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/2300 . I'm not entirely sure how to perform the workaround though. If someone could explain how to do that for me I would appreciate it.

Start -> cmd, "cd" to the folder where your ckan.exe is, then run the command.

Recently started getting an error:

Popup:

"Failed to connect to repository.  Exception: Value cannot be null.

Parameter name: collection"

 

Main CKAN window:

"Connection to https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-meta/archive/master.tar.gz could not be established"

This occurs on both pre-existing installations (1.3.1, and 1.2.2) as well as a fresh install of 1.3.1.  If I close the popup I can launch KSP from CKAN.  I just can't install any new mods.

16 minutes ago, SeaTac said:

Ok.  What do I update?

In CKAN:

Settings, then click Check for Updates

If that doesn't work, then download it directly from here:

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/releases

17 minutes ago, udidwht said:

If I start CKAN from the desktop it starts fine but clicking the CKAN settings prompts me... 'An unhandled exception has occurred...'

Object reference not set to an instance of an object...blah....blah...blah

Click Continue, then Refresh.

4 minutes ago, HebaruSan said:

Click Continue, then Refresh.

Much appreciated, that seems to have corrected it.

Using 1.24. When I select and then apply a mod, it downloads it and then installs it, but once the install is complete, it comes back to the Manage Mods screen but only shows about 1/4 of the mods. Doesn't matter if I filter it by compatible, new, installed it  still only shows about 50 mods. I tried refreshing that doesn't work either. The only thing that works is to shut down Ckan and restart it.

 

Anyone else having this issue?

On 2/23/2018 at 10:32 AM, politas said:

You can now import files you downloaded outside of CKAN into the CKAN cache

Can you describe this functionality, please?

Does it require a netkan file?

How does it work,exactly?

 

Thanks

1 hour ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Can you describe this functionality, please?

Does it require a netkan file?

How does it work,exactly?

  • https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/pull/2246
  • https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/pull/2264

It uses the metadata already in your registry, which contains the SHA1 and SHA256 of (nearly) every known download file. Calculate the SHA1 of an unknown ZIP, and now you know which modules it contains.

12 minutes ago, HebaruSan said:
  • https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/pull/2246
  • https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/pull/2264

It uses the metadata already in your registry, which contains the SHA1 and SHA256 of (nearly) every known download file. Calculate the SHA1 of an unknown ZIP, and now you know which modules it contains.

Ok, so it can't import an unknown file.  Got it, thanks
